title: (x) Reward - 57 Rodeo {Yves, Stephen}
content:
Can somebody identify this western type?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180156im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/14943.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Guru - Architype Renner (tilted 'G') {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180156/http:/www.typophile.com/node/26824 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Insights on the Lotus Sutra - Friz Quadrata {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180156/http:/www.typophile.com/node/1071 "Go to next forum topic")
author: nike

comments.content:
Don't know if the sample is recent enough to have used this   
newer release, but it sure looks like [57 Rodeo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180156/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/baselinefonts/57-rodeo/?refby=typographica) is from the   
same woody source.

Actually Romesh, these kinda ID's are not so hard: go to   
 [www.MyFonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180156/http:/www.myfonts.com/), type "western" in the search field and   
browse through the resulting [list](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180156/http:/www.myfonts.com/Search?searchtext=western&page=2).   
   
P.S. Is the plural of ID with or without the apostrophe?
thanks a lot yves and stephen for the quick id.

Whaddayacall early? It's already 9:50 over here; I start   
work somewhere between 8:45 and 9:15!
